paper.title: Time in Formal Protocol Specifications
paper.abstract: The need for formal, machine-readable specification of the protocols used in distributed computer systems is widely accepted. In these formal protocol specifications relatively little attention has been paid to the problem of including time â€” the time it takes to execute various portions of the protocol as well as explicit values for timeouts. In this tutorial, models for including time are reviewed. Techniques for analyzing these models are then discussed. A comprehensive bibliography is included.
